turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What's this?  What's this... this picture?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: That?  That's Hill House.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: This is where we're going?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Yes.  It's perfect, isn't it?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: There were no children.  Rene died, and <u>then</u> Hugh Crain built all of this, and then he died. His heart was broken.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Have either of you seen David Watts?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No, but Nell's been here longer than I have.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: When do we take the tests?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Every day.  Basically we'll be hanging out together like we have so far this evening.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Well this is a cozy breakfast.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Good morning, Theo.  Luke.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Maybe they're Mary's.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Mary came with me.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Get a blanket!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: It's okay... we're all here...

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Your fear of him was real.  That's all the ghost anyone needs.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: How could you do this to people?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Is she asleep?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Yes.  But I promised I wouldn't let her alone the whole night.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She needs help.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I'll take her with me to the University tomorrow.  I can't believe I read the test wrong.  I didn't see anything that looked like she was suicidal.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: He's wandering around the house, and Nell heard him.  She thought it was ghosts.  Let's go look for him again.

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: No.  If he's lost somewhere in the house... he'll have to stay lost until tomorrow, until the night is over.  What we have to do now is be together, with Nell.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Oh God, we can't get out!

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: Nell, what do we do?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm not going back to New York City.  I'm going to find an apartment with a little flower garden, where you can just see the ocean and at night, when the wind comes in just right, you can hear the sound of the harbor.  What about you?

turns.speaker: MARROW
turns.text: I'm a scientist.  I just conducted an experiment.  Now I have to write it up.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: But the experiment was a failure.

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Oh!  You scared me.

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: Me?  No.  What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Are you Mister Dudley, the caretaker?

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: Yeah, I'm Mister Dudley, the caretaker.  What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I'm with Dr. Marrow's group.  I'm supposed to check in with Mrs. Dudley up at the house.  Is she here?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Why do you need a chain like that?

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: That's a good question.  What is it about fences?  Sometimes a locked chain makes people on both sides of the fence just a little more comfortable.  Why would that be?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Is there something about the house?

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: Mrs. Dudley'll be waiting for you.

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: That's where she hanged herself.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: Rene Crain.  Up there.  Rope. Ship's hawser.  Hard to tie. Don't know how she got it.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: Why'd she kill herself?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: She was unhappy.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MR. DUDLEY
turns.text: Can't say.  Haven't been here that long.  Well, it's Labor Day, gotta get to work.

turns.speaker: MRS. DUDLEY
turns.text: It's make the soup or answer the door.  Can't do both.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Mrs. Dudley.

turns.speaker: MRS. DUDLEY
turns.text: So far.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: They're so beautiful.  Aren't they?

turns.speaker: MRS. DUDLEY
turns.text: I've seen 'em.  Lot to dust.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Well, I've never lived with beauty.  You must love working here.

turns.speaker: MRS. DUDLEY
turns.text: It's a job.  I keep banker's hours.  I set dinner on the dining room sideboard at six.  You can serve yourselves.  Breakfast is ready at nine.  I don't wait on people.  I don't stay after dinner.  Not after it begins to get dark.  I leave before dark comes.  We live in town.  Nine miles.  So there won't be anyone around if you need help.  We couldn't even hear you, in the night.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Why would we --

turns.speaker: MRS. DUDLEY
turns.text: -- no one could.  No one lives any nearer than town.  No one will come any nearer than that.  In the night.  In the dark.

turns.speaker: MRS. DUDLEY
turns.text: No one could.  No one lives any nearer than town.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: No one will come any nearer than that.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: And what you're wearing, that's great, too.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: This?  It's from a thrift shop.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What did it cost?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Fifteen dollars.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That'd be seventy in New York. You stole it!

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: It's all I could afford.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Wait.  You're not wearing that ironically?  This is really you?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I don't know what you mean.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't worry, I probably won't be in here much.  Light sleeper.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: That's why we're here.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What do you do?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I'm between jobs right now.  My last job... it... the person I was working for... the job ended. Over.  So... And you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That depends.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Not really.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Don't tell me Boston is different from New York.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Ohh, sure, you have trouble with commitment.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: My boyfriend thinks so, my girlfriend doesn't.  If we could all live together... but... they hate each other.  It's hard to be Miss Perversity when you're the only one at the party.  D'you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: A blank canvas!  I could paint your portrait, directly on you. Or maybe not.  So, you?  Husbands? Boyfriends?  Girlfriends?  Where do you live?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I don't have anyone.  But I do have a little apartment of my own.  It has a little flower garden.  You can just see the ocean.  At night, when the wind comes in just right, you can hear the buoys in the harbor.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Jeez.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I love this house.  I really love this house.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're okay.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: A monster?  But he built this for the woman he loved, like the Taj Mahal.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The Taj Mahal wasn't a palace, it was a tomb.  Why didn't he tell us?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You've been out of the world for a long time, haven't you?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Yes.  I've missed it.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: No.  The world has missed you.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Good night, Theo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You, too.  Happy tossing and turning.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: If this was some sort of joke, I'm going to kill him.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: You know it wasn't a joke, Theo.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Yes.  I feel realy rested, too. Theo?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I guess.  Oh, your hair!  It looks good.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: How could he have left without his keys?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Two sets.  I don't know.  Maybe they're not even his.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Watts?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: What's his first name?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: David.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: David?  David Watts?  Can you hear us?  David!  Daviiiiid!

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: David?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Maybe he never came in.  If he'd come in, he would have left his bags at the door, right?  Or maybe he got here early, and went for a walk, and fell.  Maybe he's outside.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Is it over?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: No, it's getting worse.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Theo... Did you?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Maybe you did it yourself.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I don't know.  You've been alone for a long time, maybe you want attention.  Maybe he did it...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's so sad.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: There's hundreds of them.  This must be a record of the children who died at the mills, like Luke said.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Before he painted your name over Mister Crain.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Well, it wasn't me.  Mister Dudley had to clean it and he knows that he's in charge of all the messes so why would he make more work for himself and...  You said the Good Doctor was with you.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I don't know what to think anymore.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Just think about one thing right now: What color?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I've never had a pedicure before.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Red.  What else?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I'm sorry I was mad at you, Theo.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Me too.  Although I learned one thing about you, that you don't know about yourself.  You can be a pretty decent bitch.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I'll take that as a compliment.  In the city, what kind of place do you live in?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I have a loft.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You want to move to New York, you want to move in with me?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I don't know, you know...

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: My place isn't like yours, Nell, it doesn't have a view of sea.  It doesn't have a view of anything. What's interesting about the way I live is what goes on inside the walls.  Living with me... My boundaries aren't very well defined, Nell.  Do you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I'm trying.  Have you ever kept something to yourself because you were afraid it'd ruin things.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Marrow said the same thing as last night, he <u>says</u> --  -- that he checked with Mrs. Dudley.  And he says that she told him that all the fireplaces in the West Wing connect to the main chimney.  He says that he thinks that the flue was open, and with the windstorm, he says that what probably happened was some kind of freak air current --

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: -- What do you think?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Then who is?  Come on, Nell.  Deep down, if you really thought it wasn't Jim, why wouldn't you be leaving right this second?  Why wouldn't you be afraid?  Really afraid.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Because I don't want to ruin things.  Because home is where the heart is.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nell, what happened?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Carolyn showed me where she hid him, hid him with all the ones he killed --

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: This is real, I'm not making it up!  Theo, you saw it!  You were there -- the banging and last night.  You, you all saw the painting!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Nell, it makes sense.  It all makes sense.  You and I, we were scaring each other, working each other up.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: -- but the painting!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm going to stay with you until you fall asleep.  And then I'm going to get some brandy.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: I don't think I want any.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: They're all in here.  All the ones he killed.  They're just children! We have to help them!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Come on!  Why are we waiting?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What'd you come back for, babe?

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Just had to be sure.

turns.speaker: NELL
turns.text: Oh, Theo.  You know I don't have an apartment.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Then let's go get you one.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Adhara.  I told your father, if you're looking for a name, you can't go wrong with a constellation.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: I used to hate it.  Now I like it.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Could be worse, he could've named you Reticulum.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Is there anything in the world that you want or need?

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: I <u>want</u> to know why you <u>need</u> that scary guy in your house.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Gordon?  He's been with me for years. He's not as tough as he looks.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Then what good is he?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Is it possible that you're too young to be acquainted with the idea of loyalty?

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Is that a problem?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Not for you, clearly.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: I'm loyal to things that make me happy.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Am I a thing?

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Well, you're certainly not a person.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I'm not.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: No.  You're not specific enough to be a person.  You're more like a vibe.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I'm so glad we're having this chat.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: It's not a knock.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: It's not a compliment.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: It's an observation.  Like:  I'm hungry. When are we eating?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: As soon as you get dressed.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: What kind of food?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Anything but Japanese.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I'm not into finger foods.  Too fussy.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Like you.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I don't like do-it-yourself cuisine. Buffets.  Salad bars.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: You demand to be served.  A fork fetishist.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: It's just fuel to me.  I'm not there for distractions.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: For some, eating is a sensual experience. <u>The</u> sensual experience.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: That's what Gordon's always saying.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Oh, god.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Italian?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Italian.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Not who, food.  Should we get Italian.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: I like the colors.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: We all did.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: It must've been a time.  A golden moment.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Hey, I thought you weren't a buffet person.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I'm a gracious host.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: I've lived in L.A. all my life, I've never done this drive.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: All your life.  That happened while I swam the length of my pool.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Nothing.  I guess it's hard to pass on this road.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: The freeway's faster, but lacks a certain majesty.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Just feels like the car behind has been following us the longest time.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I sure hope so.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: We think someone is here.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: We think?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: We can't find ...  ... two of our guys.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ADHARA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Because --

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Come over here.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: How they goin', kid?

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Not bad.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: How'd you like to kill someone for me?

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Same as last time -- the rest after.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Where do we go?

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: When you find the guy, you'll know.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: What shit is this.  I just do it.  I don't prepare it.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: I'll point you in the right direction, but you'll have to take it to the end- zone.  He's a hit-and-run gunman -- I figure he's not cruising the Polo Lounge.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: This is un-fucking professional.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: See, a successful man like me has limitations -- I lose touch at a street level.  So I have to depend on a smart boy like you who's closer to the nitty and the gritty than I am.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Fuck you, Mr. whatever-your-name is. This is a lifestyle I embrace.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: That's why I'm letting you take care of this.  I'm the one with appearances to maintain.  But who gives a shit about you?  Not even God.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: What.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: There's been some trouble downtown.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: What kind?

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: What the papers used to call a "gangland slaying."

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Our black friends?

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: No, Terry.  They don't work like that. Jenny Wilson's father paid a little visit, left a message.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I thought he was in prison, in England.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Well, either they have a very liberal work-release program, or he's out, because he's here in L.A., looking for you.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: You should have let me do the talking.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Why, because you're my security consultant?  This cocksucker nearly burnt my house down.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: What did you tell them.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I mean, Gordon must weigh a good four hundred pounds.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: Heavier than that now.  But are there any drugs in that stomach to back up your story.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: As it happens.  I didn't make that part up.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: And where is this guest?  Don't they want to interview him.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: I don't know everyone here.  He was so traumatized he split.  Maybe he was Gordon's <u>pusher</u>.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Where do <u>you</u> think he is, Mike.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: We'll find him.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: No.  I mean.  Not even your people should be involved.  Right?  It's too close now.

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: You could use a few of my prime shitkickers up here.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: You think I'm staying?

turns.speaker: AVERY
turns.text: There's already gonna be talk about how people close to you keep falling into canyons.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Well, can we make it one more.  Nowhere the fuck near me.

turns.speaker: CREEP
turns.text: You broke last time.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: Let him break - he likes to break.

turns.speaker: CREEP
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I wouldn't talk.

turns.speaker: CREEP
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: STACY
turns.text: I saw your mother on the Strip last night.  She went up to three guys, said she'd like 'em to stick one in each, know what I mean?

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: Oh really?  Where you from?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: England.  Only, we saw there was a show on, thought I might pick something up for a price, type of thing.

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: You came to the right place, sir.  My wife's second cousin is English.  Well, Scotch-Irish.  Can I interest you in a holster?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Just luck, this, really.  Never been to one of these before.

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: You're in gun country now, my friend.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Been to the Boat Show.

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: Packs a punch, but it's compact, has accessible features -- makes a nice concealed-carry piece.

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: I can take care of the paperwork.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: No problem.  If <u>you</u> don't have a problem with me reporting this gun stolen.

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: Man knows what he likes.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Lookin' good.

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: That's a high-end item.  Total reliability.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What'd you call that -- the Protector?

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: Yes, sir.  Won't find a better CQC on the market.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: CQ what?

turns.speaker: DEALER
turns.text: Close Quarters Combat.  Keep one in my own home.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Edward Rama?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Eduardo.  Rama.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: You're home, then.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I didn't expect anyone.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: No reason.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I mean, what has it been -- six months?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Round about, yeah.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I didn't even know who I was writing to -- just someone with the same last name. She never talked about any family.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: It was better than a telegram.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Who done it, then?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Snuffed her.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I never said nothin' about nothin' like that.  No, no, no.  That's not what I wrote to you.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: No, but between the lines, eh? Mysterious circumstances, and that.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: This bloke she was bunked up with.  This Terry what'sit.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Terry Valentine.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Valentine.  What's he got to say for himself?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I dunno.  What's he gonna say?  They had a fight that night, she drove away, she was upset?  I don't even know the guy. Don't get me wrong, Jenny and me were friends, but we didn't travel in the same social circles.  She had her life, I had mine.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: What more is there.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm just sayin' -- it was a steep hillside.  There was no moon that night ...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Coulda happened to anyone, man.  I never knew her to be reckless.  I mean, sure, she would smoke a little grass, or something, have a few drinks.  But that's it, nothing more than that.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: No, not my girl.  Self-control, she had. Point of pride.  And people don't change, do they.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I dunno ... Maybe they do.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Boomerang.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Y'what?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I knew when I was droppin' that letter into the mail slot it was gonna come back and smack me in the face.  I did my time, okay?  My sister, her ol' man's up in Chino right now doin' eight years.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: This ain't your lot?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You kiddin', man?  I don't need a wife and screamin' kids.  I still got my youth.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I go to work, try to keep my life together, put all that shit behind me, man.  What d'you want from me.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: I only asked.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: What, tryin' to catch him with another bird?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That's what I thought, man.  But it was not a hotel or nothin' that we went to. It was someplace else.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Where abouts?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bad place, man.  Bad people.  Some guys loading some trucks.  Some kinda deal goin' down.  I don't know and I don't care.  Maybe they're shipping fava beans to Eskimos.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Did Jenny know?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Valentine wasn't even there.  If he was into something, if she was involved -- who can say.  But I'll tell you something.  She stood in front of these dudes, man.  Eyeballing <u>them</u>.  Checking <u>them</u> out.  I felt like she was covering <u>my</u> ass that day.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What you gonna do, man?  You gonna go to the cops?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Nah, coppers don't do nothing, do they.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Those streets up in the hills, man. Gotta be real careful, keep your eye on the ball.  Two o'clock in the morning, it's dark, your mind is all agitated, you're drivin' a little too fast ...  Those curves don't kid around.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You should talk to Elaine.  That was her best friend.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: She didn't write to me, did she.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: She didn't know what to say.  I thought someone should say something. To someone.  With me it was, I don't know -- Jenny liked me for some reason.  I felt like I owed her.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Who'd Jenny get it off of -- this grass or whatever?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Not me, man.  I'm no drug dealer, what you think.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: I think you didn't get that lot in the Navy, doing your National Service.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I already told you, man.  Corcoran.  Know what that is?  State prison.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Nick's a nick, n' it?  No matter what state you're in.  State of remorse, most likely -- for gettin' caught.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But that's not me anymore.  That's when I was into the gang lifestyle.  That's not who I am now.  Five years in the joint -- that's it for me, man.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You're kiddin' me, right?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: What do I do, then, look in the bleedin' Yellow Pages?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: These are not guys you can just go run a number on, man.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Thought perhaps there'd be dispensing machines, you know.  Bung in your coins, come out with a .44 Magnum, fully-loaded.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Are you a resident of California? You gonna fill out forms, man?  Do the background check?  Go through a three-day waiting period?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Sod that.  Gotta get back before my probation officer wonders where I've skived off to.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Probation?  Man, you crazy.  They shouldn't've let you outta your country, much less prison.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Travelling on a dodgy passport, n' all.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: He don't have a concealed weapons permit.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Don't have time for a lot of paperwork, y'know.  Just popped over on a quick visit.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: No.  Not at all.  Do we?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Not me, man.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: I mean, it's already a steal, n'it -- what you said -- four hundred for this one?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You hadda show up on a weekend.  This weekend.  Wouldn't've even been a gun show ... for another month.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Fucking out of order, that.  Shouldn't be allowed.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Now what.  You gonna take your new arsenal, go visit Terry Valentine, just like that?  Boom bam boom.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: It's only insurance.  Can't be too careful.  This Terry Valentine, he's probably a wonderful fella.  They were together how long?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Five years, I think.  Long time.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Well, there you are.  Jen must've liked him.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Jenny told me she met him at the beach. Got blinded by his smile.  You believe that shit?  Son of a bitch never smiled at me.  Buried her at a "private" service.  Private for who. Him?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Hang about.  I thought you said he come into the restaurant where you worked with Jenny.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: He came in with Jenny to the restaurant where I work.  That's not where they met.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: And that's where you met Jenny.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, no -- Jenny used to work as a waitress.  Before she met him.  But that's not where she met me.  Not in my restaurant.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: How'd the two of you hook up, then?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, Jenny was in my acting class.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Told you you wouldn't be able to see through that gate.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Gate's open.  I had a butcher's at the house.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Who'd you butcher at the house?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Butcher's hook.  Look.  I don't much reckon those minders of his.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: He's brought in the heavy mob.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Extra muscle.  Bodyguards.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Has he?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: They look a right load of wallies. Patrolling back and forth outside the gate, all ponced up like the fuckin' Household Cavalry.  Watch it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That was one of them?

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: See what I mean?  Wearing bloomin' uniforms n' all.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: What's so fucking funny?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Those aren't guards.  They're valets.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Valets.  What d'ya mean valets.  What is he, then, the Earl of fucking Doncaster?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: <u>Valets</u>.  They park cars.  He's having a party.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Valets, eh?  Aren't we all la-de-da.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I thought you just wanted to check out the house, man.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: Well, that's what we're doin', n' it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No one else is even here yet.

turns.speaker: WILSON
turns.text: First in, first out, that's me.
